defenses.Militia: There are able-bodied men and women with worn weapons ready to be called, but no standing force.

defenses.Watch: There are a few watchers posted who look out for trouble and settle small problems, but their main role is to summon the militia.

defenses.Guard: There are armed defenders at all times with a total pool of less than 100 (or equivalent). There is always at least one armed patrol about the steading.

defenses.Garrison: There are armed defenders at all times with a total pool of 100–300 (or equivalent). There are multiple armed patrols at all times.

defenses.Battalion: As many as 1,000 armed defenders (or equivalent). The steading has manned maintained defenses as well.

defenses.Legion: The steading is defended by thousands of armed soldiers (or equivalent). The steading’s defenses are intimidating.

population.Exodus: The steading has lost its population and is on the verge of collapse.

population.Shrinking: The population is less than it once was. Buildings stand empty.

population.Steady: The population is in line with the current size of the steading. Some slow growth.

population.Growing: More people than there are buildings.

population.Booming: Resources are stretched thin trying to keep up with the number of people.

prosperity.Dirt: Nothing for sale, nobody has more than they need (and they're lucky if they have that). Unskilled labor is cheap.

prosperity.Poor: Only the bare necessities for sale. Weapons are scarce unless the steading is heavily defended or militant. Unskilled labor is readily available.

prosperity.Moderate: Most mundane items are available. Some types of skilled laborers.

prosperity.Wealthy: Any mundane item can be found for sale. Most kinds of skilled laborers are available, but demand is high for their time.

prosperity.Rich: Mundane items and more, if you know where to find them. Specialist labor available, but at high prices.

tags.Safe: Outside trouble doesn't come here until the players bring it. Idyllic and often hidden, if the steading would lose or degrade another beneficial tag get rid of safe instead.

tags.Religion: The listed deity is revered here.

tags.Exotic: There are goods and services available here that aren't available anywhere else nearby. List them.

tags.Resource: The steading has easy access to the listed resource (e.g., a spice, a type of ore, fish, grapes). That resource is significantly cheaper.

tags.Need: The steading has an acute or ongoing need for the listed resource. That resource sells for considerably more.

tags.Oath: The steading has sworn oaths to the listed steadings. These oaths are generally of fealty or support, but may be more specific.

tags.Trade: The steading regularly trades with the listed steadings.

tags.Market: Everyone comes here to trade. On any given day the available items may be far beyond their prosperity. +1 to supply.

tags.Enmity: The steading holds a grudge against the listed steadings.

tags.History: Something important once happened here, choose one and detail or make up your own: battle, miracle, myth, romance, tragedy.

tags.Arcane: Someone in town can cast arcane spells for a price. This tends to draw more arcane casters, +1 to recruit when you put out word you're looking for an adept.

tags.Divine: There is a major religious presence, maybe a cathedral or monastery. They can heal and maybe even raise the dead for a donation or resolution of a quest. Take +1 to recruit priests here.

tags.Guild: The listed type of guild has a major presence (and usually a fair amount of influence). If the guild is closely associated with a type of hireling, +1 to recruit that type of hireling.

tags.Personage: There's a notable person who makes their home here. Give them a name and a short note on why they're notable.

tags.Dwarven: The steading is significantly or entirely dwarves. Dwarven goods are more common and less expensive than they typically are.

tags.Elven: The steading is significantly or entirely elves. Elven goods are more common and less expensive than they typically are.

tags.Craft: The steading is known for excellence in the listed craft. Items of their chosen craft are more readily available here or of higher quality than found elsewhere.

tags.Lawless: Crime is rampant; authority is weak.

tags.Blight: The steading has a recurring problem, usually a type of monster.

tags.Power: The steading holds sway of some type. Typically political, divine, or arcane.
